intro: Armeriastrum tenuifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved armeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to conserve water in arid environments.
